intro: Senecio goodianus, commonly known as the Good's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers that are clustered in a composite head, surrounded by pale green bracts. Senecio goodianus is often used in rock gardens due to its low maintenance and ornamental value.
